selected_quotes: The complexity of simplicity-something we should consider with our treatment of people with pain.
The complexity of simplicity: Role of sex, development, and environment i... #Psychiatry

citation.abstract: Anecdotally, we all know stress is "complicated", but most stress research is undertaken using incredibly simplified models that may not allow us to fully understand underlying interactive mechanisms that are present in the "real world". This attempt at simplification, while sometimes necessary, may explain some of the difficulties in translating basic science findings to the clinical and epidemiological data on stress and stress-related disorders. In a symposium at the 2015 International Society for Psychoneuroendocrinology meeting in Glasgow, UK, a series of speakers explored "The many pathways to plasticity in the stress system", specifically focusing on variables that are in many cases eliminated from studies of stress in order to provide increased experimental control. Specifically, four speakers tackled the complex contributions of Sex, Development, and Environment in stress research, providing evidence from published and unpublished work from their own laboratories demonstrating that in our race for simplicity in experimentation, the stories we tell become all the more complex. This article is protected by copyright. All rights reserved.
citation.title: The complexity of simplicity: Role of sex, development, and environment in modulation of the stress response
